description: Returns a list of anomalies that log anomaly detectors have found. For details about the structure format of each anomaly object that is returned, see the example in this section.

nested_items.name: anomalies
nested_items.description: An array of structures, where each structure contains information about one anomaly that a log anomaly detector has found.

nested_items.name: anomalyId
nested_items.description: The unique ID that CloudWatch Logs assigned to this anomaly.

nested_items.name: patternId
nested_items.description: The ID of the pattern used to help identify this anomaly.

nested_items.name: anomalyDetectorArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the anomaly detector that identified this anomaly.

nested_items.name: patternString
nested_items.description: The pattern used to help identify this anomaly, in string format.

nested_items.name: patternRegex
nested_items.description: The pattern used to help identify this anomaly, in regular expression format.

nested_items.name: priority
nested_items.description: The priority level of this anomaly, as determined by CloudWatch Logs. Priority is computed based on log severity labels such as FATAL and ERROR and the amount of deviation from the baseline. Possible values are HIGH, MEDIUM, and LOW.

nested_items.name: firstSeen
nested_items.description: The date and time when the anomaly detector first saw this anomaly. It is specified as epoch time, which is the number of seconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC.

nested_items.name: lastSeen
nested_items.description: The date and time when the anomaly detector most recently saw this anomaly. It is specified as epoch time, which is the number of seconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: A human-readable description of the anomaly. This description is generated by CloudWatch Logs.

nested_items.name: active
nested_items.description: Specifies whether this anomaly is still ongoing.

nested_items.name: state
nested_items.description: Indicates the current state of this anomaly. If it is still being treated as an anomaly, the value is Active. If you have suppressed this anomaly by using the UpdateAnomaly operation, the value is Suppressed. If this behavior is now considered to be normal, the value is Baseline.

nested_items.name: histogram
nested_items.description: A map showing times when the anomaly detector ran, and the number of occurrences of this anomaly that were detected at each of those runs. The times are specified in epoch time, which is the number of seconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC.
(string) ---
(integer) ---

nested_items.name: logSamples
nested_items.description: An array of sample log event messages that are considered to be part of this anomaly.

nested_items.name: timestamp
nested_items.description: The time stamp of the log event.

nested_items.name: message
nested_items.description: The message content of the log event.

nested_items.name: patternTokens
nested_items.description: An array of structures where each structure contains information about one token that makes up the pattern.

nested_items.name: dynamicTokenPosition
nested_items.description: For a dynamic token, this indicates where in the pattern that this token appears, related to other dynamic tokens. The dynamic token that appears first has a value of 1, the one that appears second is 2, and so on.

nested_items.name: isDynamic
nested_items.description: Specifies whether this is a dynamic token.

nested_items.name: tokenString
nested_items.description: The string represented by this token. If this is a dynamic token, the value will be <*>

nested_items.name: enumerations
nested_items.description: Contains the values found for a dynamic token, and the number of times each value was found.
(string) ---
(integer) ---

nested_items.name: inferredTokenName
nested_items.description: A name that CloudWatch Logs assigned to this dynamic token to make the pattern more readable. The string part of the inferredTokenName gives you a clearer idea of the content of this token. The number part of the inferredTokenName shows where in the pattern this token appears, compared to other dynamic tokens. CloudWatch Logs assigns the string part of the name based on analyzing the content of the log events that contain it.

nested_items.name: logGroupArnList
nested_items.description: An array of ARNS of the log groups that contained log events considered to be part of this anomaly.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: suppressed
nested_items.description: Indicates whether this anomaly is currently suppressed. To suppress an anomaly, use UpdateAnomaly.

nested_items.name: suppressedDate
nested_items.description: If the anomaly is suppressed, this indicates when it was suppressed.

nested_items.name: suppressedUntil
nested_items.description: If the anomaly is suppressed, this indicates when the suppression will end. If this value is 0, the anomaly was suppressed with no expiration, with the INFINITE value.

nested_items.name: isPatternLevelSuppression
nested_items.description: If this anomaly is suppressed, this field is true if the suppression is because the pattern is suppressed. If false, then only this particular anomaly is suppressed.

nested_items.name: nextToken
nested_items.description: The token for the next set of items to return. The token expires after 24 hours.
